Description: Shoulder sherd of Aeolian grey ware pottery dinos; inscription incised on exterior; well-polished shiny surface; drill hole in broken edge for analysis.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Gardner (1888 p. 47) notes that the vessel probably originated from Mytilene or Lesbos and the inscription is a dedication made by a Mytilenean or Lesbian, since the dialect, -ai, is not Ionic. The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.626 and most probably 1924,1201.60.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 685, no. 438, pl. 25.15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.175)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
